Making abortion illegal benefits a community by ensuring fewer women will die from pregnancy-related complications. No, wait—it won’t. Outlawing abortion benefits a community because it makes sure that all products of conception receive adequate housing, nutrition, medical treatment and education until they are adults. Well, no, not that either. Making abortion illegal guarantees all children will be parented with love and affection, and none will be abused or neglected. Nope on that one too. Criminalizing abortion means a woman will not experience economic hardship, underemployment, or career interruption because of her pregnancy and childrearing. Uh, no, I guess not. Abolishing legal abortion ensures that no victim of sexual violence, child or adult, will have to gestate and deliver her rapist’s child. Oh crap, that won’t either. Outlawing abortion benefits communities because it means there will no longer be any children spending years in institutions or temporary foster care while they wait to be adopted. No, that’s not likely either. The only benefit I can possibly imagine is the smug, self-righteous satisfaction anti-abortion activists derive from a position that harms others.
